commit_message:
Analysis of 2019 User Survey Feedback

The 2019 OpenStack User Survey was the first time
that the OpenStack Technical Committee submitted
questions.  After some review at the Ussuri PTG
in Shanghai the TC has come up with the following
analysis.

Change-Id: Ia72323805e4eb8c2407bf8d9dfdfe066f860b2a3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/82/698582/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ===================================== Analysis of 2019 User Survey Feedback ===================================== Introduction ------------ The OpenStack Technical Committee (TC) added questions to the User Survey for the first time in 2019. The following questions were asked by the TC: * How do you upgrade your version of OpenStack? * Once on a given release, do you use stable branches for bugfix upgrades? * To which projects does your organization contribute maintenance resources, such as patches for bug fixes and code reviews on master or stable branches? * How do members of your organization contribute to OpenStack? * What prevents you or your organization from contributing more maintenance resources, or makes contributing difficult? * Other ways to participate? The intention of these questions was to understand how users are maintaining their OpenStack clouds and how they are interacting with the community. In the case that they weren't currently interacting with the community it was hoped that the questions would spark thoughts on how they could participate in the future. In general the TC was pleased with the number of responses they got to the questions and the information provided. As a result it was decided that the TC won't revise the questions before the next User Survey. The plan is to look at the responses to the next survey and then decide if any questions need to be revised or changed. Below we will summarize the responses that were received to each of the questions: How do you upgrade your version of OpenStack? --------------------------------------------- This is the question to which we got the greatest response. The following were the available responses to choose from and the associated number of responses: * Upgrade all coordinated releases (once every 6 months) -- 73 users * Skip/Fast-foward releases -- 91 users * Not Upgrade -- 119 users * Deploy regularly from master branch -- 30 users * Deploy all intermediary releases and all coordinated releases -- 24 users So the responses here were spread pretty widely. The number of users who respond that they don't upgrade explains why there are so many people still running on releases like Mitaka and Newton. The number of users that do skip or fast-forward updates supports the efforts that have gone into making such an upgrade path possible. For a future survey it would be interesting to ask the users who are not upgrading why that is the case. Would be good to know if this is due to it being seen as too dificult a thing to do or if it is just that the users don't see a need. Once on a given release, do you use stable branches for bugfix upgrades? ------------------------------------------------------------------------ This question also had good participation with about two thirds of the users responding to the question. The responses were also pretty evenly spread across four of the five options: * I do not do bugfix upgrades -- 40 users * Yes, backporting specific fixes -- 45 users * Yes, deploying every commit on the stable branch -- 9 users * Yes, upgrading upgrading at various points in time depending on fixes -- 56 users * Yes, using only official point releases -- 66 users Not surprisingly, deploying every commit being the least popular option. The fact that the majority of users reported using the official point releases speaks to the importance of continuing to do stable releases. Similar to the previous question, it would be interesting to know why the people who do not do bugfix upgrades choose that route. It would also be interesting to correlate if these are the same people who responded that they don't upgrade at all or if this is a different group of users that go from major release to major release only. To which projects does your organization contribute maintenance resources such as patches for bug and reviews on master or stable branches? ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- About one third of users responded to this question. The results were as one would expect with core projects having the greatest participation. The top 5 were as follows: * Nova -- 45 users * Neutron -- 43 users * Cinder -- 27 users * Keystone -- 26 users * Glance -- 25 users Other projects that had participation numbers in the low twenties include: OpenStack Ansible, Octavia, Ironic and Kolla. Heat, Horizon, Swift and OpenStack Client were in the fifteen to twenty user range. One interesting thing to note in the results is the fact that users who responded, generally contributed to more than one project. There were a few examples where contribution to only one project was indicated, but this was not the majority case. How do members of your organization contribute to OpenStack? ------------------------------------------------------------ More than half of the users responded to this question. For the most part the answers were evenly spread with the exception of submitting bug reports which was the clear winner for participation. Here is the breakdown: * Backporting bug fixes to stable branches -- 34 users * Bug fixes on master -- 54 users * Bug reports -- 123 users * Code review on master -- 46 users * Code review on stable branches -- 30 users * Feature design review -- 33 users * Documentation improvement -- 49 users * Participate in Forum Sessions at the Summit -- 70 users * Participate in PTG Sessions -- 38 users * Participate in Ops Meetups -- 57 users * Contribute resources to run CI jobs upstream -- 12 users * Sponsor in-person events -- 30 users * Host third-party jobs downstream -- 13 users Keeping in mind that this was a user survey, these results are very interesting. Over one quarter of the users that responded submit bug fixes on master and nearly as many also do code reviews. Many of the users are also taking advantage of the Forum Sessions and Ops Meetups. As with the previous question, it seemed that users who participated indicated participation in multiple ways. This would seem to support one of the things that we highlight as being unique about our community. We are users and developers collaborating together. What prevents you or your organization from contributing more maintenance resources, or makes contributing difficult? --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- There were a lot fewer responses to this question. The field was also a free-form field, rather than multiple choice which seems to generally get fewer response. Of the 69 user responses, the majority of them had to do with a lack of time or human resources. Other responses indicated that they were busy running their data centers, going along with the theme of insufficient time. There were a few surprising responses with regards to it not being clear how to contribute. Hopefully the user survey got them thinking about other ways to contribute. There has been a good focus in OpenStack on making how to contribute easier to understand both through documentation and through education opportunities. Perhaps there is a need to better socialize these opportunities? Other ways to participate: -------------------------- This was another free-form field that did not get a lot of responses. There were a few responses that are worth noting as they show other ways that users work to participate. There were responses indicating that they particpate in OpenStack associations. Doing such things is important to keep communication in the community flowing. Another user indicated that they write blogs on how to do things. We talk about documentation as a way to contribute but forget to mention that blogs can also be a great way to contribute and share information. Similarly, another user indicated that they help write troubleshooting guides. Another great way to help the wider community. Finally, one other user indicated that they work with their distributor to communicate and create requirements for future enhancements. This was interesting as it is an indication that we may not directly see the ways that people are participating with the community. All-in-all these responses continued to support the collaborative nature of the OpenStack community. Summary ------- The TC was please with the first round of answers we got from the User Survey. We don't feel a need to change the questions for the next survey. This will give us a chance to see if responses are consistent between surveys or if there appears to be variation. After that round we may choose to refine the questions. There weren't any really surprising responses this time around. The collaborative nature of OpenStack Users is aparent in the results. We will want to ensure that we don't see a decline in those numbers. In the mean time, we should be proud of the unique and diverse nature of the community we have helped to develop.

commit_message:
Add "fields" parameter to ListSecurityGroup query

This new query parameter will allow to send a query sending the
"fields" parameter. This "fields" parameter contains the needed
API fields, translated into OVO fields in Neutron server, that
require to be retrieved from the DB.

As commented in the related bug, the OSC "list" command only
prints five parameters, none of them the security group rules. In
systems with a reasonable amount of security groups, skipping the
unnecessary rule load can save a lot of time.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710820/
Change-Id: I16f48e292997d029d68f66365db949b9f4b5a0c8
Closes-Bug: #1865223

commit_message:
[WIP] Enable IGMP snooping by default

Multicast support has been introduced in core OVN upstream.
This patch is enabling IGMP snooping by default on all the
Logical Switches.

TODO:

* Functional tests
* Maintenance task to update previously created lswitches

Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I5189ce31682c7501cdff7a74bc824b8491377549
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
HA: check before restarting resource on stack update

When container <service>_restart_bundle is run, it checks whether
it can call pcs to restart the associated pacemaker resource, when
applicable.
Make sure we enforce the checks in all cases (when we run during
a stack update / update converge, and during a minor update).

Change-Id: I0367a657ddf440f0b73c4de5346306f12439db15
Closes-Bug: #1868533
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/07/714407/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: bundle_can_be_restarted() { local bundle=$1 # As long as the resource bundle is managed by pacemaker and is # not meant to stay stopped, no matter the state of any inner # pcmk_remote or ocf resource, we should restart it to give it a # chance to read the new config. [ "$(crm_resource --meta -r $1 -g is-managed 2>/dev/null)" != "false" ] && \ [ "$(crm_resource --meta -r $1 -g target-role 2>/dev/null)" != "Stopped" ] } if bundle_can_be_restarted ${BUNDLE_NAME}; then echo "$(date -u): Restarting ${BUNDLE_NAME} globally" /usr/bin/bootstrap_host_exec $TRIPLEO_SERVICE /sbin/pcs resource restart --wait=__PCMKTIMEOUT__ $BUNDLE_NAME else echo "$(date -u): No global restart needed for ${BUNDLE_NAME}." fi if bundle_can_be_restarted ${BUNDLE_NAME}; then
deleted_lines: echo "$(date -u): Restarting ${BUNDLE_NAME} globally" /usr/bin/bootstrap_host_exec $TRIPLEO_SERVICE /sbin/pcs resource restart --wait=__PCMKTIMEOUT__ $BUNDLE_NAME # As long as the resource bundle is managed by pacemaker and is # not meant to stay stopped, no matter the state of any inner # pcmk_remote or ocf resource, we should restart it to give it a # chance to read the new config. if [ "$(crm_resource --meta -r ${BUNDLE_NAME} -g is-managed 2>/dev/null)" != "false" ] && \ [ "$(crm_resource --meta -r ${BUNDLE_NAME} -g target-role 2>/dev/null)" != "Stopped" ]; then

commit_message:
Add warning about avoiding artl_gzip option

This should prevent future accidents of adding artcl_gzip option inside
this file, which overrides any other environment specific values.

Change-Id: Icc9201cfc74a131767316955a57649b2eb377d78
Closes-Bug: #1861378
Signed-off-by: Sorin Sbarnea <ssbarnea@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Implement validations-libs Run method for tripleoclient

Remove validations run code and call validations-libs
instead for Run command in tripleoclient.

The results management should move away as an utils
function in validations-libs.

Some options should be nice to implement in the
validation tripleoclient cli

Change-Id: Ie264d7631aba9b8beb9962e1694446f6968170e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/64/711964/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from validations_libs import run as vf_run #@TODO matbu : implement extra env vars option extra_env_vars = None #@TODO matbu : implement ansible_cfg option ansible_cfg = None #@TODO matbu: implement quiet option and --limit quiet = True limit = None vrun = vf_run.Run() results = vrun.run_validations(playbooks=playbooks, inventory=static_inventory, group=parsed_args.group, extra_vars=parsed_args.extra_vars, validations_dir= constants.ANSIBLE_VALIDATION_DIR, validation_name= parsed_args.validation_name, extra_env_vars=extra_env_vars, ansible_cfg=ansible_cfg, quiet=quiet) #@TODO should implemented as a utils function in validations-libs
deleted_lines: extra_vars_input = {} if parsed_args.extra_vars: extra_vars_input = parsed_args.extra_vars if parsed_args.extra_vars_file: extra_vars_input = parsed_args.extra_vars_file if parsed_args.group: LOG.debug(_('Getting the validations list by group')) try: output = oooutils.parse_all_validations_on_disk( constants.ANSIBLE_VALIDATION_DIR, parsed_args.group) for val in output: playbooks.append(val.get('id') + '.yaml') except Exception as e: print( _("Getting Validations list by group name" "finished with errors")) print('Output: {}'.format(e)) else: for pb in parsed_args.validation_name: if pb not in oooutils.get_validation_group_name_list(): playbooks.append(pb + '.yaml') else: raise exceptions.CommandError( "Please, use '--group' argument instead of " "'--validation' to run validation(s) by their name(s)." ) failed_val = False with oooutils.TempDirs() as tmp: with ThreadPoolExecutor(max_workers=parsed_args.workers) as exe: LOG.debug(_('Running the validations with Ansible')) tasks_exec = { exe.submit( oooutils.run_ansible_playbook, plan=parsed_args.plan, workdir=tmp, playbook=playbook, playbook_dir=constants.ANSIBLE_VALIDATION_DIR, parallel_run=True, inventory=static_inventory, output_callback='validation_json', quiet=True, extra_vars=extra_vars_input, gathering_policy='explicit'): playbook for playbook in playbooks } results = [] for tk, pl in six.iteritems(tasks_exec): try: _rc, output = tk.result() results.append({ 'validation': { 'validation_id': pl, 'logfile': None, 'status': 'PASSED', 'output': output }}) except Exception as e: failed_val = True results.append({ 'validation': { 'validation_id': pl, 'logfile': None, 'status': 'FAILED', 'output': str(e) }})

commit_message:
Implement validations-libs show command

Remove old code from validation and implement validations-libs
Show command instead.

Change-Id: If78d475d222244f4e0c4159d873fde815be36048
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/35/713235/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from validations_libs import show as vf_show LOG.debug(_('Show validation result')) try: vshow = vf_show.Show(parsed_args.group, constants.ANSIBLE_VALIDATION_DIR) data = vshow.show_validation(parsed_args.validation_id) return data.keys(), data.values() except Exception as e: raise RuntimeError(_("Validations listing finished with errors\n" "Output: {}").format(e))
deleted_lines: validation = self.get_validations_details(parsed_args.validation_id) logfile_contents = oooutils.parse_all_validations_logs_on_disk( validation_id=parsed_args.validation_id) if not validation: raise exceptions.CommandError( "Could not find validation %s" % parsed_args.validation_id) return self.format_validation(validation, logfile_contents) def get_validations_details(self, validation): results = oooutils.parse_all_validations_on_disk( constants.ANSIBLE_VALIDATION_DIR) for r in results: if r['id'] == validation: return r return [] def format_validation(self, validation, logfile): column_names = ["ID"] data = [validation.pop('id')] if 'name' in validation: column_names.append("Name") data.append(validation.pop('name')) if 'description' in validation: column_names.append("Description") data.append(textwrap.fill(validation.pop('description'))) if 'groups' in validation: column_names.append("Groups") data.append(", ".join(validation.pop('groups'))) other_fields = list(validation.keys()) other_fields.sort() for field in other_fields: column_names.append(field.capitalize()) data.append(validation[field]) # history, stats ... total_number = 0 failed_number = 0 passed_number = 0 last_execution = None dates = [] if logfile: total_number = len(logfile) for run in logfile: if 'validation_output' in run and run.get('validation_output'): failed_number += 1 else: passed_number += 1 date_time = \ run['plays'][0]['play']['duration'].get('start').split('T') date_start = date_time[0] time_start = date_time[1].split('Z')[0] newdate = \ time.strptime(date_start + time_start, '%Y-%m-%d%H:%M:%S.%f') dates.append(newdate) if dates: last_execution = time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', max(dates)) column_names.append("Number of execution") data.append("Total: {}, Passed: {}, Failed: {}".format(total_number, passed_number, failed_number)) column_names.append("Last execution date") data.append(last_execution) return column_names, data

commit_message:
Fluentd: Add fluent-plugin-prometheus

This change adds the official prometheus plugin
to our fluentd image, which provides better metrics
than the exporter side car currently being used in
our chart.

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix: DevStack guide

* Fix the path for the sample files
* Change the title to include the word OVN
* Remove the networking-ovn references
* Fix host OS versions recommendations
* Run "nova-manage cell_v2 discover_hosts" prior to listing the
  hypervisors

Change-Id: Id2ce2a8913a9fb5ce9482b360dea9503a0b279da
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

OVN driverOVN comes with another sample configuration file that can be used $ cp ../neutron/devstack/ovn-compute-local.conf.sample local.conf

subject: [L3HA] Fix sending MLDv2 packets from gw ports on backup nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-01-16 12:19:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/1c8cee78706e5a08a9cfa9dd9996b856aecce782', 'message': 'WIP [L3HA] Fix sending MLDv2 packets from gw ports on backup nodes

This patch is work in progress still. There are no any tests for now
created for it. I first would like to know what L3 experts from our team
thinks about this idea.

In some cases, e.g. after network node reboot, there may be race
between neutron-l3-agent which is configuring routers with gateway
ports (qg-XXX) in router's namespace and neutron-openvswitch-agent
which is wiring such port in br-int.
If neutron-openvswitch-agent will do its job before neutron-l3-agent
removes IPv6 link-local addresses from such qg-XXX port, MLDv2 packets
from this interface will be send to the wire. That will cause learning
where qg-XXX's MAC address is by ToR switch and it will cause break
in connectivity to the router.

To avoid that, this patch introduces new flag "bind_device" which is
set by L3 agent in port's other_config. For L3 HA case this flag is
set to "no" initially. If value of this flag is set to "no" than
neutron-openvswitch-agent will not set proper tag for such port and
will keep DEAD_VLAN (4095) tag on it thus MLDv2 packets send from this
interface will be dropped in br-int.
After neutron-l3-agent will finish all configuration for such port,
which means that it will e.g. remove IPv6 link-local addresses from it,
it will set this flag to "yes" and then neutron-openvswitch-agent will
finish wiring the port in br-int and set proper tag.

Change-Id: I9e7e20679b41847810696307f05dd9b7b252ab88
Closes-Bug: #1859832
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-01-30 14:21:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/677337aca3ccb1bd1862dd3afb18d94d95b2492b', 'message': 'WIP [L3HA] Fix sending MLDv2 packets from gw ports on backup nodes

commit_message:
[L3HA] Fix sending MLDv2 packets from gw ports on backup nodes

In some cases, e.g. after network node reboot, there may be race
between neutron-l3-agent which is configuring routers with gateway
ports (qg-XXX) in router's namespace and neutron-openvswitch-agent
which is wiring such port in br-int.
If neutron-openvswitch-agent will do its job before neutron-l3-agent
removes IPv6 link-local addresses from such qg-XXX port, MLDv2 packets
from this interface will be send to the wire. That will cause learning
where qg-XXX's MAC address is by ToR switch and it will cause break
in connectivity to the router.

To avoid that, this patch introduces new flag "internal_status" which is
set by L3 agent in port's other_config. For L3 HA case this flag is
set to "inactive" initially. If value of this flag is set to "inactive" than
neutron-openvswitch-agent will not set proper tag for such port and
will keep DEAD_VLAN (4095) tag on it thus MLDv2 packets send from this
interface will be dropped in br-int.
After neutron-l3-agent will finish all configuration for such port,
which means that it will e.g. remove IPv6 link-local addresses from it,
it will set this flag to "active" and then neutron-openvswitch-agent will
finish wiring the port in br-int and set proper tag.

Change-Id: I9e7e20679b41847810696307f05dd9b7b252ab88
Closes-Bug: #1859832
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/56/702856/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Delete neutron ports for Failed/Succeeded pods

This covers the scenario presented by k8s jobs in which the pods
are completed after the job and result in either Failed or Succeeded
state. Kubelet calls the CNI DEL for such pods so we should also delete
the neutron port and the corresponding annotation.

Closes-Bug: 1868074
Change-Id: I513784139b361da609f66dc2128970c8eae784c5
Signed-off-by: Nayan Deshmukh <n.deshmukh@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Add new repositories under TripleO governance

Those repositories being linked to validations, it makes sense to put
them in the "tripleo-validations" set. Some renaming might come later,
but for now, it's more than OK like that.

commit_message:
Track orphan instances and error migrations in resource tracker

We need to calculate assignments based on tracked instances and
migrations, so we take orphan instances and error migrations into
consideration since there may be resources occupied by them but
not cleaned up.

Besides, we update existing periodic task _cleanup_incomplete_migrations
and _cleanup_running_deleted to improve the cleanup, including
specific resource cleanup like vpmems.

Change-Id: Ida8dc7a01db096c269ef18656c5a373ce08ee58c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/51/678451/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Grab all error migrations: error_migrations = objects.MigrationList.get_by_filters( context, {'host': self.host, 'status': 'error'}) migrations = migrations + error_migrations orphans, orphan_uuids = self._find_orphaned_instances() orphan_insts = objects.InstanceList.get_by_filters( context, {'uuid': orphan_uuids}, expected_attrs=['migration_context'], use_slave=True) for instance in orphan_insts: migration_ctxt = instance.migration_context if not migration_ctxt: self.tracked_instances.add(instance.uuid) continue migration = objects.Migration.get_by_id_and_instance( context, migration_ctxt.migration_id, instance.uuid) self.tracked_migrations[instance.uuid] = migration return orphans, orphan_uuids

commit_message:
Add devstack-plugin-nfs project under QA

devstack-plugin-nfs is devstack plugin to
configure the NFS backend.

We are going to bring this plugin under QA
project.

Detail discussion: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-March/013048.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711834/
Change-Id: Ib37815eb7fc917ce7258010b82301d0cfef803e1

commit_message:
Add non-default Redfish service mount location

The `--service-endpoint` option can now contain a path
to Redfish API mount point. If not set, it defaults
to sushy default which is `redfish/v1`.

Change-Id: Ic7737b92c70af738c7998e412cb59d149418542e

commit_message:
Drop use of unittest2

unittest2 was needed for Python versions <= 2.6, so it has not been
needed for quite awhile (ever in this project). See unittest2 note on:

https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html

This drops unittest2 in favor of the standard unittest module.

Change-Id: I21264290d783d582dfb886b799781380dbf5757d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Explicitly set ramdisk type

The ironic-lib-base job is based on ironic-base job which
will default to dib.
To prevent breaking the ironic-lib CI we set the ramdisk
type to tinyipa for now and we'll convert the jobs here later.

Change-Id: I9a03943a838b53518b052874296744c97feea249
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-lib refs/changes/18/714418/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE: tinyipa

commit_message:
Explicitly set ramdisk type

The sushy-tempest-ironic-partition-redfish-src job is based on
ironic-base job which will default to dib.
To prevent breaking the sushy CI we set the ramdisk
type to tinyipa for now and we'll convert the jobs here later.

Change-Id: Id58e612da796bdac633adb74156edb16d133ce10
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sushy refs/changes/47/714447/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE: tinyipa

commit_message:
Explicitly set ramdisk type

The ironicclient-tempest job is based on ironic-base job which
will default to dib.
To prevent breaking the ironicclient CI we set the ramdisk
type to tinyipa for now and we'll convert the jobs here later.

Change-Id: I078152aca364edd7e7fac2f9cac2557b93ced4b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/43/714443/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IRONIC_RAMDISK_TYPE: tinyipa

subject: config-download timeout should KILL the process.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-18 18:06:01.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/actions/ansible.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/7be36f305107c0bfb4e403f5df4226635e34dffa', 'message': 'config-download timeout should KILL the process.

The timeout command defaults to using TERM which does
not always ensure that it will end soon enough. The
ansible-playbook command should end as soon as possible.

Change-Id: I0f97772434040f04f9495239b9a432c1ac062555
Closes-Bug: #1867968
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
config-download timeout should KILL the process.

The timeout command defaults to using TERM which does
not always ensure that it will end soon enough. The
ansible-playbook command should end as soon as possible.

Change-Id: I0f97772434040f04f9495239b9a432c1ac062555
Closes-Bug: #1867968
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/07/713707/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: command = ['timeout', '-s', 'KILL', str(self.command_timeout)] + command

commit_message:
Add nodes tagging support - API

- set node tags
- get a list of tags of a node
- remove all tags from a node
- node list tags/tags_any/not_tags/not_tags_any
  filter support
- include tags in node details

Partial-bug: #1526266
Co-Authored-By: Vladyslav Drok <vdrok@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I027e024364bea73babbbd5cb9be22cab1f9ca3f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/78/250478/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_tags_names(tags): return [t.tag for t in tags.objects] class Tags(base.APIBase): """API representation of the tags for a node.""" tags = wtypes.ArrayType(str) """tags of the node""" @classmethod def sample(cls): tags = {'tags': ["tag1", "tag2"]} return cls(tags=tags) class NodeTagsController(rest.RestController): @expose.expose(Tags, types.uuid_or_name) def get(self, node_ident): """List the tags of a node. :param node_ident: UUID or logical name of a node. """ node = objects.Node.get(pecan.request.context, node_ident) tags = objects.NodeTagList.get_by_node_id(pecan.request.context, node.id) return Tags(tags=_get_tags_names(tags)) @expose.expose(Tags, types.uuid_or_name, wtypes.ArrayType(str), status_code=http_client.ACCEPTED) def put(self, node_ident, tags): """Modify the tag list of a node. :param node_ident: UUID or logical name of a node. :param tags: List value; tags of a node. """ node = objects.Node.get(pecan.request.context, node_ident) tags = objects.NodeTagList.set(pecan.request.context, node.id, tags) return Tags(tags=_get_tags_names(tags)) @expose.expose(None, types.uuid_or_name, status_code=http_client.ACCEPTED) def delete(self, node_ident): """Remove the tags of a node. :param node_ident: the UUID or logical name of a node. """ node = objects.Node.get(pecan.request.context, node_ident) objects.NodeTagList.destroy(pecan.request.context, node.id) '/raid_config', '/target_raid_config', '/tags'] tags = NodeTagsController() """Expose tags as a sub-element of nodes"""

commit_message:
Add nodes tagging support - RPC objects

- Version of the Nodes RPC object bumped to 1.22
- This patch does not include the tags field in the Node API object
  (this is going to be done in a subsequent patch)

Partial-bug: #1526266
Co-Authored-By: Vladyslav Drok <vdrok@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: Ie0ff6ad6f83b4ae1029e57a0c55678ea9a525ba4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/57/233357/68 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ironic.objects import tagsTag = tags.Tag TagList = tags.TagList Port, Tag, TagList)

subject: Add DB layer support for node tags filters

- tags-any: have any of the given tags

added 4 filters.

commit_message:
Add DB layer support for node tags filters

- tags: a node has all the given tags
- tags-any: a node has any of the given tags
- not-tags: a node that has all of the given tags is filtered out
- not-tags-any: a node does not have any of the given tags

Partial-bug: #1526266
Co-Authored-By: Vladyslav Drok <vdrok@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I93c27dbf3249141613f8ace895e982f084546d1f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/24/272624/36 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: max-complexity=18

commit_message:
Add support for console ports allocation/de-allocation

Initialize port Bitmap in conductor, and modify related methods.

- validate()
- start_console()
- get_console()

Change-Id: I2b5d012a8a59a8be15e534140842e58b7d76e590
Closes-Bug: #1526371
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/89/257789/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Huawei Technologies Co. Ltd. # All rights reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """A Port Bitmap class to handle allocation/de-allocation of console ports.""" from six import moves from ironic.db import api as dbapi class PortBitmap(object): """Setup a port bitmap for allocation/de-allocation.""" # Keep track of the ports that have been allocated/de-allocated # uses a bitmap to do this def __init__(self, min_port=6900, max_port=65535): self.min_port = min_port self.max_port = max_port self.dbapi = dbapi.get_instance() """Initialize the port as a set.""" self.ports = set(int(node.driver_internal_info.get('console_port')) for node in self.dbapi.get_node_list() if (node.driver_internal_info and node.driver_internal_info.get('console_port')) ) def get_next_port(self, port_num=None): """Try to get a specific port if requested or get the next port.""" min_port_search = port_num or self.min_port max_port_search = (port_num + 1) if port_num else self.max_port for port in moves.range(min_port_search, max_port_search): if port not in self.ports: self.ports.add(port) return port def release_port(self, port_num): """Return the port to the pool.""" if port_num in self.ports: self.ports.remove(port_num)

commit_message:
Use cached copy of hash ring in api service

Related-bug: #1526451

Change-Id: I195d66487cea5ad9db9cb42a8e57957302d4bfc9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/92/250692/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================== Improve Ironic API performance ============================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/improve-api-performance This blueprint tries to improve the api performance by reducing hash ring refreshing on every request. Problem description =================== Currently, the API service resets hash ring on every request, which would be accurate but cause low performance in production environment, it is unacceptable. Proposed change =============== As we already cached the hash ring object, and recently introduced a way to refresh it https://review.openstack.org/#/c/235806/, we can reuse it and add a retry logic on the rpc request, if got a Timeout exception, force refreshing the hash ring, and fetching a new active topic node to issuing the request again. * Add a new parameter to ``get_topic_for()`` which defatul to False, If set to True, then refreshing the cached hash ring. * Wrapped try-except to every rpc api, and catching the Timeout exception. * If got Timeout exception first time, we will call ``get_topic_for()`` with the refresh parameter to force fetching active conductors from the db, then issuing the request to the new conductor again. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Client (CLI) impact ------------------- None RPC API impact -------------- None Driver API impact ----------------- None Nova driver impact ------------------ None Security impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ Improve the api call performance by reducing db request. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: niu-zglinux Work Items ---------- * Add new parameter ``fresh=False`` to ``get_topic_for()`` and put hash ring refresh logic under the refresh condition. * Catching rpcapi request Timout exception, if it is, then fetching the active corresponding conductor from db, and issuing the request again Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit Testing will be added. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== None Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

Dynamically allocate console ports

Related-bug: #1526371

Change-Id: I7c573617569ee85541e2c202c4f14d045faa4db9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/76/249876/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================= Console port management ======================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/console-port-management This blueprint adds support for console terminal port allocation and de-allocation. Problem description =================== Currently we have to specify a terminal_port parameter to enable console support, which shellinabox daemon will run with, but as it's a user defined parameter, there could be some nodes with same terminal port in a conductor, which will result in only one console can be enabled, and if the node is taken over by another conductor, the port may also be used by a shellinabox service, this is unacceptable. Proposed change =============== * Add a new console_port field to nodes table, which will set when console enabled and be cleared when disabled. * Add a Port Bitmap class ``PortBitmap`` to handle allocation/de-allocation of terminal ports, which will maintain a set of used ports. - ``__init__()`` - Initialize the ports as a set, fetch used console port information from db, the new added console_port attribute. - ``get_next_port()`` - If specified a terminal port and it's not in the used ports set, then add it to the set and return the port, else find an unused port in the range which we specified in the config file and add it to the used port set. - ``release_port()`` - Remove the port from the used ports set. * Modify ``ConductorManager.__init__`` to initialize PortBitmap class, every conductor has a Port Bitmap to handle node's console port allocation and de-allocation, and when the conductor restart we can also get the Port Bitmap from db. * Modify console driver ``validate()`` method, if not specify a terminal_port, the conductor will get one for the node. * Modify ``ConductorManager.set_console_mode()`` method, if start console but not set the terminal_port parameter, get a port from the Port Bitmap, else release the console port. Alternatives ------------ Alternatively, we can store every conductor used console ports in db. Data model impact ----------------- This will add a `console_port` field to the `node` table, with an accompanying database migration. This field will default to NULL, which will also be the value when there is no port, or when console port is cleared via release port method. State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Client (CLI) impact ------------------- None RPC API impact -------------- None Driver API impact ----------------- None Nova driver impact ------------------ None Security impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: niu-zglinux Work Items ---------- * Add `console_port` to the nodes table with a migration. * Add a Port Bitmap class ``PortBitmap`` to handle allocation and de-allocation of console ports. * Initialize Port Bitmap when conductor service starts * Modify console related methods ``validate()``, ``set_console_mode`` to use the new port management mechanism. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit Testing will be added. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== None Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
Remove mock of not directly called ironic-lib methods

assertions about ironic-lib method calls that are not called directly
by ironic should be tested in ironic-lib.

Example of a breakage caused by this:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1552839

Change-Id: Ic9fb62bdd829b0ece3fa860cac11f6b0443e8f3b
Closes-Bug: #1552843

commit_message:
Check duplicate nodes enrollment/update

This spec is intended to check for duplicate nodes by adding
a new bmc_fingerprint field to Node object.

Change-Id: I5377cb851a9071cfb97b4a8bfe0b65b00e79f574
Closes-Bug: #1519605
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/57/296357/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================== Check Duplicate Nodes ===================== https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1549664 This spec is intended to add some duplicate checks during the node verifying process to avoid different available nodes associated with the same BMC. Problem description =================== As I understand One BMC should only be associated to one Ironic node, but currently we can enroll any node with the BMC information which already used by another node, then assume node-A is deployed, and the new enrolled node-B bacomes 'available' after node verifying, that means node-A can be override if a new nova boot request schedules to node-B, it's unacceptable. Proposed change =============== Add some duplicate check after power validation during node verifying process, then we can enroll a duplicate node but it can't be available. * Every driver's power interface should provide a set of properties used to distinguish nodes. Add a ``get_distinct_properties()`` method to PowerInterface to fetch the distinct properties set, which distinguishes from one node to another, for example, ipmitool's ``DISTINCT_PROPERTIES`` should contain ``ipmi_address`` and ``ipmi_target_address`` in case of using IPMI bridging. * After power validation of the node succeed in node verifying process, we should get the distinct properties from it's driver_info, for example, ipmitool should return ``ipmi_address`` if IPMI briding not used, then we select nodes with the driver which have the same ``ipmi_address``. * If the node match with another one, move it to ``fail`` state, and set the node's last_error to indicate it's duplicate. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Client (CLI) impact ------------------- None RPC API impact -------------- None Driver API impact ----------------- None Nova driver impact ------------------ None Security impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: niu-zglinux Work Items ---------- * Add ``DISTINCT_PROPERTIES`` to every PowerInterface * Add logic to check duplicate in node veirying process * Documentation updates Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Addition of unit tests as well as tempest tests to explicitly test the interface. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== None Documentation Impact ==================== Documentation will need to be updated to represent this new feature. References ========== None

subject: Add swift service check for agent drivers in devstack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-21 04:10:21.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/de9219f3f691c6290264bd55f0db7fff16763056', 'message': 'Add swift service check for agent drivers in devstack

Swift service should be enabled to use agent_* drivers, but currently
we only check whether swift tempurls set, this tries to add required
services check.

Change-Id: Ie3338a68410736984409c0a53b288398c91d4dee
Closes-Bug: #1584275
'}]
commit_message:
Add swift service check for agent drivers in devstack

Swift service should be enabled to use agent_* drivers, but currently
we only check whether swift tempurls set, this tries to add required
services check.

Change-Id: Ie3338a68410736984409c0a53b288398c91d4dee
Closes-Bug: #1584275
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/20/319520/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local req_services="s-proxy s-object s-container s-account" for srv in $req_services; do if ! is_service_enabled "$srv"; then die $LINENO "$srv should be enabled to use agent_* driver in Ironic." fi done

commit_message:
Clean nodes stuck in DELETING state when ir-cond restarts

When a conductor managing a node dies abruptly mid deleting, the
node will get stuck in the DELETING state.

Change-Id: Id9682ebdd3bbe6b4df7d607a2e499c50d7ca475a
Partial-Bug: #1651092
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/39/350439/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: filters = {'provision_state': states.DELETING} last_error = (_("The deleting can't be resumed by conductor " "%s. Moving to fail state.") % self.host) self._fail_if_in_state(ironic_context.get_admin_context(), filters, states.DELETING, 'provision_updated_at', last_error=last_error, error=True) keep_target_state=False, error=False): :param: error: if True, set nodes to error state instead of fail. if error is True: event = 'error' else: event = 'fail' task.process_event(event, task.process_event(event, target_state=target_state)

commit_message:
Install and configure for Red Hat Enterprise Linux and CentOS
miss several steps

These missing steps are about file permissions.

Change-Id: Id28c44467da9c0df8c7f2b0bec3bb87cac9afb24
Close-bug: #1777756
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/94/576694/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #. Profile permissions: .. code-block:: console # chown designate:named /etc/designate/rndc.key # chmod 640 /etc/designate/rndc.key # chgrp named /etc/designate # chmod g=rx /etc/designate # chmod 644 /etc/rndc.key # chown -R named:named /var/named

commit_message:
Drop eventlet from lower constraints

oslo.service has bumped the min requirement to 0.22.0 with
commit 19517d0bd6b34a54ae2779aff98af5172c09e4b6.

It's not directly used in tripleo-validations and there is
no reason to constrain it.

Change-Id: Icb6591068c7d13e5adc6e5876fea07063163b43e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/83/714283/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Wrong status change for port when restart neutron-linuxbridge-agent

the port need not change when restart neutron-linuxbridge-agent on
compute nodes, the judgment of host and conext host for ports was
wrong here, this will trigger all compute node to refrash firewall
and make the rabbitmq and neutron-server service will be High CPU
load.

Change-Id: Ie9a10739d8ac60c45d6b17a4f06008232fea73d8
Related-Bug: #1866743
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/56/713156/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not host or host != port_context.host:
deleted_lines: if not host or host == port_context.host:

Remove idle_timeout option

The idle_timeout parameter has been deprecated for two releases.
We can remove it.

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: Ia8fea320d8b09a89c999ace06769436a5335bcc6
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add --work-dir option to container image build command

Add --work-dir to openstack overcloud container image build command and
every run will create a unique workspace which where will be stored Kolla
configs and build logs. Default directory will be in
/tmp/container-builds. UUIDs are used to identify each time we run the
command and will be the directory name in the work dir.

Related-Bug: #1864108
Change-Id: Id3e52ba920c54c98529ecb5f723ba452362a0b32
(cherry picked from commit 7aeba8f51afbd2593886318af59697c83932b378)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/37/714437/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Add --work-dir to openstack overcloud container image build command and every run will create a unique workspace which where will be stored Kolla configs and build logs. Default directory will be in /tmp/container-builds. UUIDs are used to identify each time we run the command and will be the directory name in the work dir.

commit_message:
Fix CI

Change tox_envlist for ngs-tempest-dlm-base to py3
Disable ironic-tempest-ipa-wholedisk-direct-tinyipa-multinode
since it's disabled  in ironic.

In ironic the job is disable due to the many failures in CI

Change-Id: Ie858c6a8958f4d86f986f4b341418089e72c3463

commit_message:
Adding dummy epel and epel-modular repo

Stable/train release is failing to build containerd because it tries to
disable epel and epel-modular repo, returning an error. This patch adds
a dummy epel and epel-modular repos to fix it.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714437/
Change-Id: I9d13c274192718a07f4282485cc7f5de228ba093
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/76/713676/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # collectd tries to disable epel and epel-modular repository, which doesn't # exist, and so fail, this is just a dummy repository so the container won't # fail. - name: Add dummy epel and epel-module repository yum_repository: name: {{ item }} description: Dummy epel repository file: epel.repo baseurl: https://download.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/$releasever/$basearch/ enabled: no with_items: - epel - epel-modular

commit_message:
Remove idle_timeout option

The idle_timeout parameter has been deprecated for two releases.
We can remove it.

Change-Id: Iaed980290c707463652c36928ec24f603301a183
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/67/714367/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - Deprecated idle_timeout option has been removed.

commit_message:
Add info on how to enable ironic-tempest-plugin

To run the ironic tempest tests in DevStack locally it's
necessary to clone the ironic-tempest-plugin repository, and
add TEMPEST_PLUGINS in the local.conf

Change-Id: Iad7ca2c1f2ab5ab49493f9c7fe4738fc0bcdb5f4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/01/712901/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: If you want to run tempest tests you will need to clone the ironic-tempest-plugin repository and update your devstack/local.conf with ``TEMPEST_PLUGINS`` variable, you should set the variable with the full path for the ironic-tempest-plugin folder.:: $ git clone https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin $ vi devstack/local.conf TEMPEST_PLUGINS="<full_path>/ironic-tempest-plugin" .. note::

commit_message:
Neutron ML2/OVN: Add support to enable IGMP Snooping

Right now, there's no way to drive the IGMP Snooping knob in
Neutron from THT. This patch is adding a new parameter that
defaults to False for ML2/OVN deployments.

Change-Id: I835f8faf51dc47b300d5ebdc4e821f8c40daf065
Closes-Bug: #1868569
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/62/714462/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NeutronEnableIgmpSnooping: description: Enable IGMP Snooping. type: boolean default: false neutron::server::igmp_snooping_enable: {get_param: NeutronEnableIgmpSnooping}

commit_message:
Use pyScss2 and django-pyscss2

pyScss and django-pyscss packages are not maintained for a long time. We
can't use the pyScss with teh setuptools>=46.0.0, so I forked these
project and switch horizon to use them.

Change-Id: I38a1c2c3455a10b4852d25f6c39b3c21f5c450fc
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/712976
(cherry picked from commit 11d4954cc3e4296921d1791610f7df24d46dea4d)

a new default role in os-instance-actions API policy,
and its default role is 'rule:system_or_project_reader'.

commit_message:
Add new default roles in os-instance-actions policies

This adds new defaults roles in os-instance-actions API policies.
These policies are default to RULE_ADMIN_API and RULE_ADMIN_OR_OWNER.
Policy rules are made more granular to adopt the new defaults.

Another change is granular os-instance-actions GET API,
that adds 'os_compute_api:os-instance-actions:show' rule,
a new default role in os-instance-actions API policy,
and its default role is 'rule:system_or_project_reader'.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh
Change-Id: If5e8b050c43b3fed9a185394f2683ac2664bb98f

In order to lock to a specific minor release we need to specify all 3

commit_message:
Fix version locks

In order to lock to a specific minor release we need to specify all 3
numbers or it will pick up the next minor release. For 6.11 we were
getting 6.14.0 when the job run which is the same as the latest.

Change-Id: Idab2b1bd50ae316d9d26f5616174a3421f22b571

commit_message:
Add role/playbook to manage nova image cache

Adds a tripleo-nova-image-cache role to manage the nova local image cache on
remote compute nodes.
For multi-site/stack deployments the image can be downloaded once and
distributed to the remaining nodes in the stack to minimise WAN traffic.

Also adds a playbook to run the role using the single/multi-stack inventory
and the overcloudrc environment variables.

Change-Id: Ib5aaa22f6cf307181d8f34cf89f9f24619b43004
Implements: blueprint tripleo-nova-cache-mgmt
(cherry picked from commit 8dc6d50b1678894fea0d79d26daee51d09729ab6)

commit_message:
Add mistral workflow module path to mistral ansible config

This change extends the module path found within the the `package_update`
workflow so that we can ensure proper access to modules when ansible commands
are run from within the mistral container.

Change-Id: Id912a0786451825f48822b209400f0f72758dfc8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove CentOS7 jobs from Ussuri

RDO is moved to CentOS8 only for Ussuri, also promotion
jobs based on CentOS7 are removed[1]. So no point on running
CentOS7 jobs for Ussuri now, this patch cleans CentOS7 jobs also
replace centos7 experimental jobs with equivalent centos-8 jobs.

Also make CentOS8 jobs voting which are quite stable now[2].

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/25949/
[2]
http://zuul.openstack.org/builds?job_name=puppet-openstack-integration-5-scenario001-tempest-centos-8

commit_message:
Implement ResetConfig and ClearForeignConfig functionality

For raid deletion, existing delete_virtual_disk functionality is not
freeing up foreign drives and spares, so have added ResetConfig and
ClearForeignConfig functionality for freeing up foreign drives and
spares.

Change-Id: I76390dc4fcf8de2fe5aa3d660f77edcef4a4dec1
(cherry picked from commit 6857a6d000f7e61af872fd782092d5f4341d5f31)

commit_message:
Clear lsp.addresses always if port is OVN LB VIP port.

The check _is_virtual_port_supported() prevented us from
clearing the addresses field while port was OVN LB VIP port.
The virtual port should be set only when port is Octavia Amphorae
VIP port.

Change-Id: Id6dd29650951855d13498a7206f6d1dde7db7864
Closes-Bug: 1863893

commit_message:
Update ldap-backend options

Several of the options defined in ldap_backend.pp were using duplicate
values already specified in keystone/conf/ldap.py. Instead of
duplicating the same value, we can set them to undefined and just let
the default values from keystone come through.

This commit also updates the values of use_pool and use_auth_pool to
True so they're consistent with the default values in keystone.

Co-Authored-By: Dave Wilde <dwilde@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I507d1b736dbbb147c67b9d399c033703b432b16d
(cherry picked from commit 1081ac51db7f560e5856809480fb98c215747476)
(cherry picked from commit e59b90669832d5bc20da2da0c0ac5ed9c16e656f)

commit_message:
Deprecate unused parameters

Keystone deprecated the project and role ldap drivers in Kilo [0] and
removed it in Mitaka.

We can simplify the puppet variables by staging these options for
removal like we did with writeable user and group support:

  https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695079/

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystone/mitaka.html#deprecation-notes

Co-Authored-By: Dave Wilde <dwilde@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I8c4d6e695597548fff49a14b070bf4f96596d0a9

commit_message:
Add service version check for evacuate with qos

Id5f2f4f22b856c989e2eef8ed56b9829d1bcefb6 introduced support for
evacuation with qos ports. It enabled the support unconditionally but
the feature requires the nova-compute to be upgrade to Ussuri.

So this patch retrofits a compute service level check to the API.

blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports-ussuri

Change-Id: Ib28935edf8ee71ccc66ed6a90054eef63a5088f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/80/713680/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_evacuate_server_with_port_resource_request_old_version( self): server = self._create_server( flavor=self.flavor, networks=[{'port': self.neutron.port_1['id']}]) self._wait_for_state_change(server, 'ACTIVE') # We need to simulate that the above server has a port that has # resource request; we cannot boot with such a port but legacy servers # can exist with such a port. self._add_resource_request_to_a_bound_port(self.neutron.port_1['id']) with mock.patch( "nova.objects.service.get_minimum_version_all_cells", return_value=48, ): ex = self.assertRaises( client.OpenStackApiException, self.api.post_server_action, server['id'], {'evacuate': {}}) self.assertEqual(400, ex.response.status_code) self.assertIn( 'The evacuate action on a server with ports having resource ' 'requests', six.text_type(ex)) 'os_compute_api:os-migrate-server:migrate_live': '@', 'os_compute_api:os-evacuate': '@',

commit_message:
Add service version check for live migrate with qos

Ib9ef18fff28c463c9ffe3607d93428b689dc89fb introduced support for live
migration with qos ports. It enabled the support unconditionally but the
feature requires the nova-compute to be upgrade to Ussuri.

So this patch retrofits a compute service level check to the API.

Change-Id: I7ebfbeffdf4f04fc15d09bb9a430cc0371cbd686
blueprint: support-move-ops-with-qos-ports-ussuri
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/79/713679/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We could potentially move this check to conductor and avoid the # extra API call to neutron when we support move operations with ports # having resource requests. if (common.instance_has_port_with_resource_request( instance.uuid, self.network_api) and not common.supports_port_resource_request_during_move()): msg = _("The os-migrateLive action on a server with ports having " "resource requests, like a port with a QoS minimum " "bandwidth policy, is not supported until every " "nova-compute is upgraded to Ussuri") raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg)

subject: nova-live-migration: Wait for n-cpu services to come up after configuring Ceph
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-19 11:10:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8940bb295d2e5943b1c04de9189ba7b31870ce19', 'message': 'nova-live-migration: Wait for n-cpu services to come up after configuring Ceph

Previously the ceph.sh script used during the nova-live-migration job
would only grep for a `compute` process when checking if the services
had been restarted. This check was bogus and would always return 0 as it
would always match itself. For example:

2020-03-13 21:06:47.682073 | primary | 2020-03-13 21:06:47.681 | root
29529  0.0  0.0   4500   736 pts/0    S+   21:06   0:00 /bin/sh -c ps
       aux | grep compute
2020-03-13 21:06:47.683964 | primary | 2020-03-13 21:06:47.683 | root
29531  0.0  0.0  14616   944 pts/0    S+   21:06   0:00 grep compute

Failures of this job were seen on the stable/pike branch where slower CI
nodes appeared to struggle to allow Libvirt to report to n-cpu in time
before Tempest was started. This in-turn caused instance build failures
and the overall failure of the job.

This change resolves this issue by switching to pgrep and ensuring
n-cpu services are reported as fully up after a cold restart before
starting the Tempest test run.

commit_message:
nova-live-migration: Wait for n-cpu services to come up after configuring Ceph

Previously the ceph.sh script used during the nova-live-migration job
would only grep for a `compute` process when checking if the services
had been restarted. This check was bogus and would always return 0 as it
would always match itself. For example:

2020-03-13 21:06:47.682073 | primary | 2020-03-13 21:06:47.681 | root
29529  0.0  0.0   4500   736 pts/0    S+   21:06   0:00 /bin/sh -c ps
       aux | grep compute
2020-03-13 21:06:47.683964 | primary | 2020-03-13 21:06:47.683 | root
29531  0.0  0.0  14616   944 pts/0    S+   21:06   0:00 grep compute

Failures of this job were seen on the stable/pike branch where slower CI
nodes appeared to struggle to allow Libvirt to report to n-cpu in time
before Tempest was started. This in-turn caused instance build failures
and the overall failure of the job.

This change resolves this issue by switching to pgrep and ensuring
n-cpu services are reported as fully up after a cold restart before
starting the Tempest test run.

Closes-Bug: 1867380
Change-Id: Icd7ab2ca4ddbed92c7e883a63a23245920d961e7
(cherry picked from commit e23c3c2c8df3843c5853c87ef684bd21c4af95d8)
(cherry picked from commit 70447bca2f4f33c6872eaf94a2e4351bb257c22a)
(cherry picked from commit 373c4ffde2053c7ff11bd38339b88d144cd442f2)
(cherry picked from commit 63ed32ef49adcb6830ef3b5329a561542bddf656)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/45/713845/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function _wait_for_nova_compute_service_state { source $BASE/new/devstack/openrc admin admin local status=$1 local attempt=1 local max_attempts=24 local attempt_sleep=5 local computes_count=$(openstack compute service list | grep -c nova-compute) local computes_ready=$(openstack compute service list | grep nova-compute | grep $status | wc -l) echo "Waiting for $computes_count computes to report as $status" while [ "$computes_ready" -ne "$computes_count" ]; do if [ "$attempt" -eq "$max_attempts" ]; then echo "Failed waiting for computes to report as ${status}, ${computes_ready}/${computes_count} ${status} after ${max_attempts} attempts" exit 4 fi echo "Waiting ${attempt_sleep} seconds for ${computes_count} computes to report as ${status}, ${computes_ready}/${computes_count} ${status} after ${attempt}/${max_attempts} attempts" sleep $attempt_sleep attempt=$((attempt+1)) computes_ready=$(openstack compute service list | grep nova-compute | grep $status | wc -l) done echo "All computes are now reporting as ${status} after ${attempt} attempts" } function configure_and_start_nova { echo "Checking all n-cpu services" $ANSIBLE all --become -f 5 -i "$WORKSPACE/inventory" -m shell -a "pgrep -u stack -a nova-compute" # stop nova-compute echo "Stopping all n-cpu services" $ANSIBLE all --become -f 5 -i "$WORKSPACE/inventory" -m shell -a "systemctl stop devstack@n-cpu" # Wait for the service to be marked as down _wait_for_nova_compute_service_state "down" # start nova-compute echo "Starting all n-cpu services" $ANSIBLE all --become -f 5 -i "$WORKSPACE/inventory" -m shell -a "systemctl start devstack@n-cpu" echo "Checking all n-cpu services" $ANSIBLE all --become -f 5 -i "$WORKSPACE/inventory" -m shell -a "pgrep -u stack -a nova-compute" # Wait for the service to be marked as up _wait_for_nova_compute_service_state "up"
deleted_lines: function configure_and_start_nova { echo 'check compute processes before restart' $ANSIBLE all --become -f 5 -i "$WORKSPACE/inventory" -m shell -a "ps aux | grep compute" # restart nova-compute $ANSIBLE all --become -f 5 -i "$WORKSPACE/inventory" -m shell -a "systemctl restart devstack@n-cpu" $ANSIBLE all --become -f 5 -i "$WORKSPACE/inventory" -m shell -a "ps aux | grep compute"

commit_message:
Replace ansible --sudo with --become in live_migration/hooks scripts

Ansible deprecated --sudo in 1.9 so this change replaces
it with --become.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict due to
I3d7770589a1526e851d5764214c26ec1a9a8fd43 not being present in
stable/queens.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/live_migration/hooks/ceph.sh

(cherry picked from commit 7f16800f71f6124736382be51d9da234800f7618)
(cherry picked from commit 18931544d8a57953c6ce9ee4bf4bcc7a4e9e4295)

added_lines: $ANSIBLE primary --become -f 5 -i "$WORKSPACE/inventory" -m ini_file -a "dest=$BASE/new/tempest/etc/tempest.conf section=compute-feature-enabled option=block_migration_for_live_migration value=False"

commit_message:
Stop setting glance_api_version in cinder.conf in nova-live-migration

The glance_api_version config option was removed from cinder
in Queens [1] so we can stop setting it during the
nova-live-migration CI job.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/cinder/queens.html

Change-Id: Ifbadce909393268b340b7a08c78a6faa2d7888b2
(cherry picked from commit d1859915ab40b07c63f52da67af18145bf15244a)

commit_message:
Run unittests and lint tests on CentOS8

This patch introduces a job to run unit tests and lint tests on
CentOS8, as we are migrating from CentOS7 to CentOS8.

Note that we have a job with puppet 5.5 initially, because we still
use puppet 5.5 in rdo train, but puppet 5 will be deprecated in Ussri.

Note that we use puppet 6.4 in train so that we use the same version
as ubuntu job.

Conflicts:
	zuul.d/layout.yaml
	zuul.d/unit.yaml
Change-Id: Id643efdbab93f39ce3b168a2d1c451035547ecab
(cherry picked from commit 867f939bd6c71535b49fd6738c225f3815cf5933)

commit_message:
Add availability zone field for public shares

There is empty field for availability zone for public shares. So add
availability zone for public share in admin dashboard and user
dashboard.

Closes-Bug: #1498433
Change-Id: Ic28f360f20bf68746c287a39ec297a4782087ced

When configured to run in active-active mode, cinder creates a

When the etcd_host is an ipv6 address, the URI needs to include

"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-03-23 14:04:41.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/cinder/volume.pp', 'spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_cinder_volume_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_etcd_spec.rb', 'manifests/profile/base/etcd.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/aed9bda1b0b97305be3d147ded862f936253bac2', 'message': "Handle ipv6 addresses in etcd and cinder's backend_url

"}]
commit_message:
Handle ipv6 addresses in etcd and cinder's backend_url

When configured to use an ipv6 address, the etcd URLs and the cinder
lock manager's backend_url need to include brackets around the address.

Closes-Bug: #1868284
Change-Id: I79f385f14b5904803cdc7fdd145afa2dbcef9c49
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/75/714175/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context 'with an ipv6 etcd_host' do before :each do params.merge!({ :etcd_host => 'fe80::1ff:fe23:4567:890a', }) end it 'should normalize it in the URI' do is_expected.to contain_class('cinder::coordination').with( :backend_url => 'etcd3+http://[fe80::1ff:fe23:4567:890a]:2379', ) end end context 'with a named etcd_host' do before :each do params.merge!({ :etcd_host => 'etcdhost.localdomain', }) end it 'should craft a correct URI' do is_expected.to contain_class('cinder::coordination').with( :backend_url => 'etcd3+http://etcdhost.localdomain:2379', ) end end

commit_message:
Parse healthchecks.log instead fetching systemd data

This patch removes access to systemd for collectd container and instead
leverages the healthchecks.log created by host's rsyslog to check
for unhealthy containers. It also removes relabeling /var/run, though
we still need the access for purposes of collectd plugins.

Change-Id: Ib2d1a9132270661331ea139a299a8f8478f56eeb
(cherry picked from commit 7dd4ed097d82c12b78955efba4e3fd138eafc272)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/46/713346/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: output="" while read line ; do i=$(echo $line | awk '//{gsub(/:/, "", $0); print $5}') log=$(echo $line | awk '{split($0,a,/:\s+Error:\s+/); print a[2]}') log=${log:0:-1} output+=" ; ${i}: ${log}" done < <(egrep "^[a-zA-Z]{3}\s+[0-9]{2}\s+[0-9\:]{8}\s+.*\s+.*:\s+[Ee]rror\:" /var/log/collectd/healthchecks.log) truncate -s0 /var/log/collectd/healthchecks.log
deleted_lines: output='' for i in $(systemctl list-timers --no-pager --no-legend "tripleo*healthcheck.timer" | awk '{print $14}'); do i=${i%.timer} if result=$(systemctl show $i --property=ActiveState | awk '{split($0,a,/=/); print a[2]}'); then if [ "$result" == 'failed' ]; then timestamp=$(systemctl show $i --property=InactiveEnterTimestamp | awk '{print $2, $3}' ) log=$(journalctl -u $i -t podman --since "${timestamp}" --no-pager --output=cat --directory /var/log/journal) if [ ! -z "$output" ]; then output="$i: $log ; $output" else output="$i: $log" fi fi fi done - /var/log/journal:/var/log/journal:ro - /usr/lib/systemd/system:/usr/lib/systemd/system:ro

subject: conf: give available_cinder_storage a sensible default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-23 21:51:46.000000000', 'files': ['whitebox_tempest_plugin/config.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/whitebox-tempest-plugin/commit/1e124bd995e3b2f26a68a6897826b0fbde1584f7', 'message': 'conf: give available_cinder_storage a sensible default

We appear to be breaking plugin sanity jobs in tempest that do not set
available_cinder_storage. In those cases, the skipCheck is throwing
TypeErrors like so:

File "whitebox_tempest_plugin/api/compute/test_virtio_scsi_attach.py",
line 112, in VirtioSCSIDisk

@testtools.skipUnless(CONF.whitebox.available_cinder_storage > 8,

TypeError: '>' not supported between instances of 'NoneType' and 'int'

This patch sets a 0 default value.

Change-Id: I3a46ddf17dc171f71f5687a1f19c7de9bf8266b8
'}]
commit_message:
conf: give available_cinder_storage a sensible default

We appear to be breaking plugin sanity jobs in tempest that do not set
available_cinder_storage. In those cases, the skipCheck is throwing
TypeErrors like so:

File "whitebox_tempest_plugin/api/compute/test_virtio_scsi_attach.py",
line 112, in VirtioSCSIDisk

@testtools.skipUnless(CONF.whitebox.available_cinder_storage > 8,

TypeError: '>' not supported between instances of 'NoneType' and 'int'

This patch sets a 0 default value.

Change-Id: I3a46ddf17dc171f71f5687a1f19c7de9bf8266b8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/whitebox-tempest-plugin refs/changes/39/714539/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default=0,

subject: Recommend better rsync.conf settings

commit_message:
Recommend better rsync.conf settings

Swift doesn't recommend any rsync hostname allow/deny rules for inside
your cluster network and I've never heard of anyone using it.  The
reverse lookup on connect (even those denied for max connections) can be
overwhelming during a rebalance.  Since rsync allows explicit control of
the behavior after 3.1 we should suggest operators use it, It's also
nominally more efficient in all cases.  Possible drawback is maybe in
the future a Swift operator has good reason to use host allow/deny rules
and don't realize the rsync settings we recommend are mutually exclusive
with their customizations.

Change-Id: I2fdffdf1cc0a77f994c1d7894d5a1c8e5d951755
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/08/714008/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # since rsync default for reverse lookup is true, you have to set it to false # here globally or after a few 100 nodes your dns team will fuss at you reverse lookup = false
